newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps steady to touch firmer, but slow.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps steady to touch firmer, but slow.

text.p: NWE oil swaps were steady to a touch firmer on Friday in quiet markets. Crude's consolidation over $18.00 a barrel was supportive, but rumours of a heavy sell-off before the close caused concern, traders said.
Gasoline swaps were $1 firmer, naphtha broadly steady Brent crude CFDs a touch weaker close in but stronger further out.
Brent CFDs had a very quiet day with one of the market's main players noticeably reticient.

July 14-18 was pegged at -18 cents against August Brent from -13 cents while July 21-25 fell one cent to -24/25 cents from -23/24 cents. July 28 to August 1 was a few cents firmer at -26 cents from -28 cents and August 4-8 strengthened to -27 from -29.
July 28-August 1 traded against September Brent in the morning at -25 cents.

Heavy fuel was a touch stronger, reflecting some tightness in the physical market. Activity was, however, fairly dull with July holding around $85-86, August $1 contangoed and September a further $1.25 contangoed. October through to December was showing a steepish spread of $2-2.25.
Gasoline swaps were $1 or so firmer with phsyical tightness resulting from recent arbitrage trade to the United States and lower output at two refineries both important factors.
July was steady, but very slow at $184.50-185 with the gains more clearly shown in August which was up $1 at value $186.00
